alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:05AM EST until December 19 at 12:42PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tunkhannock Creek at Tunkhannock. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. In the past several families in the Lazy Brook Park were evacuated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Monday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EST.
